name: Varsity Clubs of America - Tucson
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Varsity Clubs of America - Tucson! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
This Tucson property is 2 miles from the University of Arizona. The property offers an outdoor pool, hot tub and suites with a kitchenette.
Varsity Clubs of America-Tucson suites have a spacious sitting area and work desk. The suites feature a TV in every room and a DVD player in the sitting area.
The Tucson Varsity Club is within a 15 minute drive of the Colossal Cave. The Davis Monthan Air Force Base is 8 miles from the property.

address.full: 3855 East Speedway Boulevard, Tucson, AZ 85716, United States of America

userReviews.title: Perfect golf getaway to sunshine and warmth
userReviews.positive:
My suite was 225 - if you are lucky you might be assigned this. Nice and functional suite layout and big balcony facing away from the road. Nice mountain views from the balcony. Liked making my own in room breakfast and able to reheat leftovers or make frozen dinners in the microwave - saved a few dollars and time here. 
Complimentary washer/dryer was a few steps away - and a fully equipped gym area as well. The hot tub was popular. 
Everything was clean and UpToDate.  Amanda at the front desk was exceptional - always ready to help and following through to ensure everything was good. 
Within 5 minutes there are: an ATM, McDonalds, CVS pharmacy and a Discount Tire (where i had my 10 yr old tires with dry rot cracks replaced in an hour). Tucson Botanical garden and the City's public golf courses (with a great range and practice facilities) were less than a 10 minute drive.
userReviews.negative: Somewhat loud music in the pool area from 9 to evening. Would have like to turn AC off and open the patio door for fresh air, but the music was distracting. Also morning coffee in reception is only available after 7:30 - not good for early risers with early tee-times - but McD was across the street and the suites have coffee makers with all the supplies.

userReviews.title: Comfortable hotel in central location
userReviews.positive: I have both business and family in Tucson and have stayed here several times before. It's central and close to many restaurants and activities. I like the nearby restaurants Feast (short walk) and Tito & Pep (short drive). There's also a lot of places with good vegan options in the area, like Del Cielo Tamal and Falora Pizza. The rooms are a little dated but exceptionally clean which is most important to me, and it's great to have a full kitchen. The bathrooms are always very clean and have plenty of counter space for getting ready. There's also plenty of free parking which is great. It's just about a 15 minute drive to either downtown or La Encantada in the foothills. Easy to get to most everything by car.
userReviews.negative: They add a 'resort fee' to your total before you reserve your room and it seems higher to me than other places I've stayed in town. You'll want to check the total price before committing. Regardless, I think it's still a good value for the money (even with the resort fee) for such a central location.

userReviews.title: Excellent experience with super clean rooms and very friendly staff
userReviews.positive:
I wasn't expecting too much. I am not into the sports theme and my Tucson hotel experience hasn't been the best. Luckily, I was very pleasantly surprised. Amanda and Dan (asst general manager and general manager) as well as all of the property staff were super friendly and helpful. The employees all seemed genuinely happy to work there. The rooms were the cleanest of any hotel or resort in Tucson. I am very picky, bring my own cleaning supplies, and didn't even need to clean things like the bathtub or door handles like usual. The very first thing I was impressed with was the cleanliness.
The room itself was very large (560 sq ft). My room had a kitchenette, dining and living room area in addition to the bedroom and bathroom. Included were all needed supplies, as well as free laundry. It was quiet, good mountain views, and plenty of bath towels, dish towels, dish soap, bed pillows, etc.  Included a full sized small refrigerator with freezer, burners, dishwasher, etc.
The hotel itself has 3 floors, a swimming pool and hot tub area, outdoor grill area, a tiny mini golf course, plus plenty of indoor games on the tables like checkers, chess, backgammon, pool as well as shuffle board, and foosball, ping pong and other games in the game room. This would be a great hotel for a group event or party with all the fun game areas where you can sit and relax.
Rooms didn't have indoor mold like so many in Tucson.
The hotel was decorated with two Christmas trees and added little touches like pinwheel pillows on the lounge furniture. Very thoughtful and fun décor. They also had a small gift shop with food items. While the hotel doesn't have a breakfast option, they just added a coffee bar with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and apple cider. Marshmallows, cinnamon sticks, caramel, etc. were there for the choosing. Today as I checked out, they had freshly made chocolate chip cookies! I really like how the new GM Dan is added these extra touches.

userReviews.title: Fun visit in Tucson!
userReviews.positive: Very clean, pretty room with an excellent layout, loved the deep tub in the bathroom, comfy bed, plenty of closet space/drawers, and a nice kitchenette with everything we needed. TV was also very good - nice picture. It was like a small apartment! The hotel staff checked in almost daily by text with us to see if everything was okay. Even brought me a tea kettle for hot water! Just sorry we didn't have time to take advantage of all the nice amenities like ping pong, the jacuzzi,  pool, or fitness room. I also appreciated the complimentary laundry room with washers and dryers - very helpful! It was also a great location near my son's residence as well as stores, the car rental,  the university, parks, coffee shops and cafes. Nice views of the mountains. .
userReviews.negative: We were given a room that faced the busy street, so I asked if we could be given a different room. The hotel staff person apologized saying they were totally full but we could switch on the Friday after Thanksgiving if we wanted. But actually, the room was quiet and we settled in, so we didn't switch. I was also surprised by extra fees that we had to pay for the resort when we arrived. I didn't notice them online when we booked the room. We ended up paying about $25.00 per day in addition to the fee I paid on booking.com -  some of that may have been local tax? Part of it was a resort fee...

name: Red Lion Inn & Suites Tucson Downtown
description:
Located off Highway 10, this Tucson, Arizona motel features an outdoor pool and offers rooms with free WiFi.  The Tucson Convention Center is 5 minutes’ walk away.
A cable TV and tea and coffee-making facilities are offered in guest rooms at Red Lion Inn & Suites Tucson Downtown .  Each air-conditioned room includes a desk and seating area.
24-hour reception and a guest launderette are offered at Red Lion Inn & Suites Tucson Downtown . A business center with fax and photocopying services and vending machines with snacks and drinks are located on site.
The University of Arizona is 10 minutes’ drive from this motel. Tucson International Airport is 7.5 mi from the property.

name: Extended Stay America Suites - Tucson - Grant Road
description:
This Extended Stay America - Tucson - Grant Road is located in Tucson and especially designed for longer stays, with all rooms featuring a fully equipped kitchen. The hotel offers free WiFi and a 24-hour front desk.
Every kitchen at Extended Stay America - Tucson is equipped with a stovetop, microwave and a fridge. The hotel also provides guests with laundry and ironing facilities and upgraded bedding with extra pillows.
Weekly housekeeping services provided for free and daily housekeeping is provided for a fee. Towels and linen may be exchanged at the front desk. Free grab-and-go breakfast including breakfast bars, muffins, hot cereal, coffee and tea is served every morning.
The property offers free onsite parking. Attractions within close proximity to the hotel include the Pima Air and Space Museum, the Davis Monthan Air Force Base and the Tucson Convention Center.

address.full: 5050 East Grant Road, Tucson, AZ 85712, United States of America

userReviews.title: Pretty basic (and a bit overpriced) room, but excellent stay thanks to great staff
userReviews.positive: It was quiet, clean and comfortable (loved the recliner, ironing board, ample closet space, and the kitchenette), in a good location, I felt safe, and mostly the staff was OUTSTANDING. There was an issue with the payment I had already made in advance through Booking and which wasn't being sent to them, preventing the system from checking me in. They went above and beyond to resolve the issue. They handled back and forth calls with Booking and their company's higher ups to force the reservation through so I could check in while they figured out how to get from Booking the money I had already paid. They were very patient despite the utterly frustrating situation, and kept me updated. They also kindly gave me a muffin when I missed the next morning's breakfast after my very late check in :)
userReviews.negative: My room was underwhelming (badly in need of an update, small TV, only one nightstand, glitching lights), so in my opinion it is overpriced, but it was still a pleasant, comfortable stay and I'd recommend it just because you will be well taken care of.

name: Residence Inn by Marriott Tucson Williams Centre
description:
Residence Inn by Marriott Tucson Williams Center offers rooms with fully equipped kitchens and flat-screen TVs with HBO. The hotel, 3 miles from Reid Park Zoo, features an outdoor pool and a hot tub.
The spacious guest rooms provide Wi-Fi, dining areas and seating areas with sofa beds. They also have desks and ironing facilities.
Residence Inn by Marriott Tucson Williams Center offers guests a gym and a Sports Court with tennis, volleyball and basketball courts. It has a meeting room and barbecue area and provides a grocery shopping service.
Residence Inn is 6 miles from Kartchner Caverns State Park and Mt. Lemmon Ski Valley and 10 miles from Tucson International Airport. It is 12 miles from International Wildlife Museum and 19 miles from Colossal Cave Mountain Park.

address.full: 5400 East Williams Circle, Tucson, AZ 85711, United States of America

name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott Tucson at The Bridges
description:
Located within 3.6 miles of Arizona Stadium and 5.4 miles of Tucson Convention Center, SpringHill Suites by Marriott Tucson at The Bridges has rooms in Tucson. The property is around 3.7 miles from Reid Park Zoo, 5.1 miles from Tucson Museum of Art and 7.4 miles from Pima Air & Space Museum. Rialto Theatre is 3.5 miles from the hotel and Pima County Public Library is 3.9 miles away.
Pima Air Museum is 8.1 miles from the hotel, while Tucson Raceway Park is 13 miles from the property. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 3.7 miles from SpringHill Suites by Marriott Tucson at The Bridges.

name: Best Western Royal Sun Inn & Suites
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Best Western Royal Sun Inn & Suites! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Just 1 miles from University of Arizona and Tucson city center, this hotel features an on-site restaurant, a hot, made-to-order breakfast and free Wi-Fi. Tucson International Airport is  7 miles away.
All rooms at Best Western Royal Sun Inn & Suites are equipped with a flat-screen cable TV and coffee maker. The spacious rooms also offer a desk and seating area.
Best Western Royal Sun Inn & Suites has a full-service business center, a gym and an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub. Guests can take advantage of a garden courtyard, complete with a pond and fountains. The hotel is eco-friendly and pet-friendly.
Royal Sun Lounge offers daily happy hour specials and weekly entertainment. Royal Sun Restaurant serves dinner daily.
Davis-Monthan Air Force Base and Pima Air and Space Museum are within a 20-minute drive. Sabino Canyon is within a 30-minute drive.

name: Ramada by Wyndham Viscount Suites Tucson East
description:
Only 8.1 mi from Tucson International Airport, this all-suite hotel features free WiFi, a daily hot breakfast buffet, a fitness center and heated outdoor pool and hot tub. Tucson city center is 4 miles away.
A separate seating area with cable TV and dining area with microwave and small fridge is included in each 2-room suite at Ramada by Wyndham Viscount Suites Tucson East. Mountain or atrium views are offered.
A hot American buffet breakfast is provided daily in the Atrium Cafe. Wilbur's Grill, open for lunch and dinner, serves American pub-style cuisine and features an extensive beer, wine and cocktail menu. Room service is available.
A 24-hour reception welcomes guests to Ramada by Wyndham Viscount Suites Tucson East. A business center and guest launderette are located on site for convenience.
Davis Monthan Air Force Base is 5.2 mi away. The University of Arizona is 3.7 mi away.

userReviews.positive: Our stay was super comfortable, and all areas of the hotel were clean. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to accommodate us in any way. The breakfast was better than most places we've stayed, and the hostesses were amazing. Great place to stay and I would recommend your establishment.

userReviews.title: A good price for a hotel that does need to have maintenance issues fixed and rooms updated.
userReviews.positive:
Breakfast was the best we experienced in the hotels we stayed in.  They even have a 'Popcake' machine for pancake lovers.  Otherwise, breakfast burritos were available to be assembled with good ingredients.  No hot chocolate though, only coffee and tea.  
Room was quiet at night.  Outdoor hot tub was ok, but could of been a little hotter.  The price was very good, but you aren't getting a super well maintained property for your money.
userReviews.negative:
Breakfast was good but dinner was a different story...I got a veg burger that wasn't actually on the menu but was available and served very undercooked.  I would describe it as pink and cold to the touch.  They did bring a fully cooked one out after I showed the waitstaff.
1st room was overlooking restaurant roof fans so I asked for a better location and they upgraded us to a room away from the fan view and it was up 1 floor.  These are large rooms because of a separate sitting room with it's own tv.  However, a few negative points.  First, cleanliness score is low here.  See photo of a vent in the bathroom that is easily in reach of a normal sized person to clean.  Maybe some disagreement about who cleans the vents? Housekeeping or maintenance?  Also, the shower/tub really needs to be upgraded as there appears to be some mold covered by fresh caulking.  No stoppers in either bathtub or sink, but I wouldn't soak in that tub anyway, as it appears very well used and grubby.  No obvious bath fan running but there appears to be some ventilation in the bathroom.  Both of the bed mattresses in the room were apparently very well used and maybe had never been rotated.  They were very soft on one side, indicating they were over used.  The room thermostat was missing a cover (photo), again its a maintenance issue. Room windows need to be cleaned as the sun was so bright outside during our stay but because of that sun, the grime on the windows was very evident! The extra room, besides the bedroom, was pretty dimly lit. Carpets were not very clean looking, in the room and in the common hallways. This hotel seems like one with great potential but has hit hard times and just needs to be refreshed.  It really would be a great place, with a large atrium area, if updated.
userReviews.room: Double Room with Two Double Beds - Non-Smoking

name: Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Downtown
description:
Located in Tucson and with Tucson Convention Center reachable within a 12-minute walk, Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Downtown provides concierge services, non-smoking rooms, a fitness center, free WiFi throughout the property and a shared lounge. Featuring an ATM, this property also provides guests with a sun terrace. Guests can have a drink at the snack bar.
At the hotel, all rooms come with a desk. Complete with a private bathroom equipped with a shower and free toiletries, all guest rooms at Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Downtown have a TV and air conditioning, and selected rooms here will provide you with a seating area. The rooms will provide guests with a fridge.
The accommodation offers a buffet or American breakfast.
Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Downtown has a grill.
Speaking English and Spanish, staff are ready to help around the clock at the reception.
Popular points of interest near the hotel include Tucson Museum of Art, Rialto Theatre and Tucson City Hall. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 6.8 miles from Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Downtown.

address.full: 141 South Stone Ave, Tucson, AZ 85701, United States of America

userReviews.title: A room you could live in
userReviews.positive:
Rooms are larger than hotel normal and can be divided on half with a curtain on a track, sofa bed on one side, King bed on the other.  Efficient use of space.  One wall had kitchen with medium-sized fridge, microwave, and dishwasher, counter with oval pull-out table underneath and desk chair, TV cabinet with three drawers,another counter with cabinet, and wardrobe with curtain closure.  The other side has nice bath with stall shower and tile floor, sleeper sofa and large round foot stool, and King bed.  One floor and three table lamps, so good lighting.
The breakfast area is very welcoming, more like a lounge with a very high ceiling, and lots of choices, with an employee present to clean and restock.
Our Booking reservation said breakfast was not included, but it was.  It also said parking was $20/day, but it was $16.
Easy walk to dinner restaurants.
userReviews.negative: The AC unit didn’t do very well in keeping a constant comfortable temperature; it got stuffy and then too cold when the AC was turned on to recirculate the room air.

userReviews.positive: Very clean, huge room for the price, full size fridge and microwave. The walk in shower was very nice. The TV was on a swivel wlso you could watch from the couch or the bed. The window had 2 remote controlled blinds, one regular and the other blackout so the sun didn't wake us. The hotel is withing walking distance of a lot of great restaurants and activities downtown.
userReviews.negative:
The parking garage was a little hard to turn into, we have a f150 and trying to make the turn into the 7'5" (the higher clearance garage around back of the building) it was very difficult, especially since there are cars parked along the street and the street you turn in from is a one way narrow street to begin with.
The only other complaint is the elevators, there's only 2 of them and every time we went up or down it was a 5 minute wait minimum, most of the time it would stop at our floor but the elevator was already too crowded, so we'd have to wait longer. There was also one time we got on to go up to our floor (4) and I swiped my key card and pressed the 4 button and the elevator went to 2,3 then 5 and 6, then back down to 4 to let us out finally.

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Tucson-Reid Park
description:
Directly across from Reid Park, which has 2 golf courses, jogging paths and a zoo, this Tucson hotel includes 14 acres of lushly landscaped grounds with a spacious outdoor pool.
Doubletree by Hilton Tucson Reid Park features a state-of-the-art fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights. After a workout, guests can relax with a massage in one of the therapy rooms.
The guest rooms at this Tucson Doubletree boast upgraded bedding and Neutrogena bath products. Guests can relax at the end of a busy day by watching the flat-screen TV or on the balcony that overlooks the hotel's courtyard.
Cactus Rose Steakhouse at the Doubletree Tuscon-Reid Park serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch. Guests can dine next to the indoor fireplace, or on the outdoor patio. Javelina Cantina, also on-site, serves Southwestern fare in a casual, fun atmosphere.

address.full: 445 South Alvernon Way, Tucson, AZ 85711, United States of America

userReviews.positive: Price was good, location was convenient.
userReviews.negative:
They double charged me for my stay. I paid for my room thru booking.com, and when I checked in they wanted a credit card for incidentals, so i gave them my debit card.  They later charged my debit card for the stay, even though I had already paid.  I contacted Hilton and was advised the charges were reversed, but it wasn’t immediate.  Christmas is right around the corner, so it is not an ideal time to have almost $400 of my money unavailable to me because of the hotel’s clerical error.  
Also, my room was in a building that was not attached to the main hotel, with a door opening to the outside. As a woman staying alone, this was not ideal.  
At check-in, I was told that if I wanted housekeeping to clean my room during my stay, I should call the front desk the night before to let them know. When I called the front desk to request housekeeping the following day, the person who answered sounded completely confused by my request, and asked me to specify what I wanted cleaned.. then, a few minutes later, a cleaning person showed up at my door with towels and a vacuum. I told her that I wanted housekeeping to come by the following day, as I had asked the front desk, and she said ok, but then the next day no one from housekeeping returned to clean my room.
userReviews.room: Double Room with Two Double Beds - Non-Smoking

name: Courtyard by Marriott Tucson Williams Centre
description:
Located in Tucson, Arizona, this Courtyard hotel is a 15-minute drive of the University Of Arizona. All rooms have a 32-inch flat-screen TV and the hotel features an outdoor pool.
Rooms at the Courtyard Tucson Williams Center include a coffee maker, work desk and a lounge chair. Free Wi-Fi and cable TV are also offered.
Guests at the Courtyard Tucson Williams Center have free access to the gym and the business center. The Bistro- Eat. Drink. Connect.® serves breakfast and dinner as well as cocktails.
Tucson Electric Park and the Davis-Monthan Air Force Base are only a 15-minute drive from this Williams Center Tucson Courtyard hotel. Sentinel Peak Park is a 20-minute drive away.

name: Hotel Congress
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Hotel Congress! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Built in 1919, the Historic Hotel Congress is a cultural landmark located in downtown Tucson. Guests can enjoy the on-site nightclub and the award-winning restaurant, the Cup Café which offers breakfast, lunch and dinner daily. Tucson Convention Center is a 10-minute walk from the property.
Each air-conditioned room features free WiFi and has a private bathroom equipped with a bath or shower. Rooms may be affected by noise from the plaza, street, or the on-site nightclub.
The nightclub at Historic Hotel Congress has concerts and events and banquet facilities for weddings are available.
Showcased throughout the hotel are original and historically preserved features, such as vintage radios and a telephone switchboard from the 1930s.
Tucson Museum of Art is 2,650 feet from the hotel, while Reid Park Zoo is 3.1 mi from the property. Tucson International Airport is 7.5 mi away.

userReviews.positive: Congress is not for everyone, it is noisy but I really like the music playing there. The rooms are very small and not appropriate if you plan to work from your room. userReviews.title: Overall, the Congress Hotel was a fun place to stay at as long as you brought bourbon, earplugs (hotel can also supply t
userReviews.positive: Great location and historic building. nearby lots of great entertainment venues and restaurants. as a matter of fact, it is also a music venue.
userReviews.negative: Tight bathroom space and very little updates in the room to bring it into the 21st century.  not the most clean.  This booking.com site and description is a bit vague about the amount of music, duration, and other noise factors from the surrounding neighborhood. THe hotel is quite clear about the music and noise going on until at least 2am and starting up again at 7am for outdoor breakfast.  The sprinkles on our cupcake was the pet policy. Our neighbor brought their dog and left it in the room barking half the night.  For this noise, the hotel was happy to refund us.

userReviews.title: If you like historic properties, try this one out!
userReviews.positive: We stayed in one of the Cactus rooms (2nd floor) which are the quieter rooms of the hotel.  Just outside our window was a super nice open air patio that you gain access to from inside.  The rooms do not have televisions, but there is one available in a small nook (with nice sofa) that leads outdoors to the patio.   The only reason I didn't give it an exceptional rating is that due to the historic nature of the property, there is no elevator and our bathroom had a step up into it.  Just something to keep in mind.  We were there on a Monday evening so there was only one music event at the Club Congress.  The only noise we had was in the morning, with voices coming through an exhaust vent in the bathroom....maybe there were workers on the roof??  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Pretty good Happy Hour from 4-6p.  Bartender was very nice.
userReviews.negative: No free coffee in the morning.  You had to go into the Cafe and purchase it.  There are also no refrigerators in the room.  (But they were very accommodating and provided us with an ice bucket to keep our beverages cool.)  They told us when we checked in that we were not allowed to bring in our own alcohol because they have a full service bar off the lobby.

name: Graduate Tucson
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Graduate Tucson! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Set in Tucson, less than 0.6 mi from Arizona Stadium, Graduate Tucson offers accommodations with a restaurant, a fitness center and a bar. Among the facilities at this property are a 24-hour front desk and luggage storage space, along with free WiFi throughout the property. The property is 1.4 mi from Tucson Convention Center and 3.1 mi from Reid Park Zoo. Valet parking is available.
At the hotel, every room has a desk, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom.
Popular points of interest near Graduate Tucson include Tucson Museum of Art, Centennial Hall and University of Arizona. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 8.1 mi from the accommodations.

userReviews.title: Excellent hotel for a short stay in Tuscon
userReviews.positive: This is a great value hotel for a convenient and comfortable stay.  It was stylish with plenty of personality and lovely staff.  We enjoyed the bar upstairs and loved the fire-pits in the evening.  We didn't use the pool but it looked great.  The cafe downstairs served good coffee, and my husband and I worked in the communal space - which was as good as a co-working space.
userReviews.negative: Nothing.

userReviews.title: Fun and Quirky Hotel
userReviews.positive: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were the 14th floor and our view of the Catalina Mountains was hard to beat! The hotel itself is really fun. I love the mid century modern vibe and all the local art. It’s quirky and totally different from your standard chain hotel. The rooms are a good size and I liked that we had a mini fridge. The location of the hotel is great - it’s less than 10 minutes from downtown and there are quite a few restaurants and bars in close walking distance (plus an awesome bar with outdoor lounge space and fire pits on the top of the hotel itself). In terms of parking, you can valet or park down the block at a public garage. We were told there was an hourly fee but when we were there the gates were always up and we were never charged. I think valet was $28 per night, in contrast. The gym is also pretty nice - it is a decent size and even has a peloton. All in all we loved this place and would absolutely stay again.
userReviews.negative: There are a few downsides of the hotel but they are minor. First, there was a giant stain on the carpet in our room just outside the bathroom on the way to the door to the exterior hallway. It was stiff to the touch and a bit gross to walk over with bare feet. Also, the coffee was never replenished in our room. I called down twice to get more brought up over our 6 night stay and that was with just me drinking one cup a day (if my husband drank coffee too we would have been calling down daily). Lastly, there was sometimes quite a long wait for an elevator - I think one of the three was down during our stay. We were frustrated in particular that the stairs are emergency access only so we had to take the elevator up one floor to the roof whenever we went up to the rooftop bar. It felt so silly to take the elevator when we could have easily walked up one flight of stairs!

userReviews.title: Would Stay There Again!
userReviews.positive: Beautiful, Artful, Nice Smell, Unique, Secure, Valet, Rooftop Pool, bar with some foods to order, lovely personnel, Morning Coffee shop, so Convenient to UofA museums, walk to shops and trolley!

name: Aloft Tucson University
description:
Featuring free Wi-Fi, an outdoor pool and a 24-hour gourmet pantry, this hotel is 2 miles from downtown Tucson. Tucson International Airport is 8 miles away.
Extra-large windows and high ceilings are available in all rooms at the Aloft Tucson University. A 42-inch flat-screen cable TV, small fridge and coffee-making facilities are also provided.
Ironing and dry cleaning services are available at Tucson University Aloft. A business center is on site for guest convenience.
The University of Arizona is less than a 5-minute walk away. University of Arizona Medical Center is less than 1 miles from the hotel.

name: Tucson Marriott University Park
description:
Located at the main gate of The University of Arizona and within walking distance of the University Medical Center, this hotel features an on-site American restaurant and flat-screen TVs.
The rooms at Tucson Marriott University Park offer a seating area with a work desk.  A coffee maker, hair dryer, and ironing facilities are provided.  WiFi is available.
Tucson Marriott University Park provides child services.  Concierge and room services are also available to guests.  The hotel facilities include a gym, outdoor pool, and a hot tub.
The Tucson International Airport is a 20-minute drive from Tucson Marriott University Park.  Tucson Mountain Park is a 30-minute drive away.

userReviews.title: Great hotel
userReviews.positive: I liked the hotel a lot. It was recently remodeled and updated, modern and completely clean. The hotel’s location is very good. It’s next to the University Of Arizona, which is very nice. There is also a little shopping/restaurant street next to the hotel with many different options for food. The distance to Downtown Tucson is walkable (approx 15 min). I got a room on the 6th floor with a nice city view. The room was huge and had a lot of space. It was updated and ideally clean. The room had a small balcony which is a big plus. My king-sized bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was also big and it had a huge shower stall. The bathroom amenities were of a good quality. Wi-Fi was working very fast. I 100% recommend this hotel for a stay in Tucson.
userReviews.negative: I can not point out any minuses of the hotel.

name: Arizona Inn
description:
In downtown Tucson, this historic hotel features 14 acres of landscaped grounds, 3 on-site restaurants and an outdoor heated pool. The University of Arizona is less than half a mile away.
Free Wi-Fi, a flat-screen cable TV and a small refrigerator are standard in each guest room at the Arizona Inn. A private bathroom with bathrobes and hairdryer is also provided.
The Main Dining Room is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and features fine dining. The Audubon Bar, open for lunch and dinner, has patio dining and a piano music in the evenings. Poolside dining and room service are also available.
A fitness center, tennis courts, badminton, croquet and ping-pong facilities are on site. A free bike rental is available. Free valet and self-parking are provided.
The University Medical Center Hospital is a 10-minute drive away. Tucson International Airport is a 20-minute drive from the Arizona Inn.

description:
Located within 2.1 miles of Arizona Stadium and 3.7 miles of Reid Park Zoo, Hampton Inn Tucson Downtown, Az has rooms in Tucson. Among the facilities at this property are a 24-hour front desk and an ATM, along with free WiFi throughout the property. Pima Air & Space Museum is 10 miles away and Pima Air Museum is 11 miles from the hotel.
At the hotel, the rooms come with a desk, a TV, a private bathroom, bed linen and towels. All rooms at Hampton Inn Tucson Downtown, Az feature air conditioning and a closet.
Guests at the accommodation can enjoy a buffet or an American breakfast.
Popular points of interest near Hampton Inn Tucson Downtown, Az include Tucson Convention Center, Tucson Museum of Art and Rialto Theatre. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 6.8 miles from the hotel.

name: The Leo Kent Hotel, Tucson, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel
description:
Located in Tucson and with Tucson Convention Center reachable within a 10-minute walk, The Leo Kent Hotel, Tucson, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel has express check-in and check-out, non-smoking rooms, a fitness center, free WiFi and a bar. The property is around 2 miles from Arizona Stadium, 3.8 miles from Reid Park Zoo and 11 miles from Pima Air & Space Museum. Pima Air Museum is 12 miles from the hotel and Tucson Raceway Park is 16 miles away.
The hotel will provide guests with air-conditioned rooms with a desk, a safety deposit box, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom with a bath or shower. At The Leo Kent Hotel, Tucson, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel rooms come with bed linen and towels.
The daily breakfast offers à la carte, continental or American options. At the accommodation you'll find a restaurant serving American cuisine. Vegetarian, dairy-free and gluten-free options can also be requested.
Speaking English and Spanish at the reception, staff are always at hand to help.
Popular points of interest near The Leo Kent Hotel, Tucson, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel include Tucson Museum of Art, Tucson City Hall and Pima County Public Library. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 7.5 miles from the hotel.

userReviews.title: This was such an easily accessible eclectic Southwestern Hotel which is a throwback to the 1930s
userReviews.positive: What I absolutely loved about this place was that it was a throwback to a time that no longer exists. My dad grew up in Tucson Arizona and took us all around this area many years ago and showed us all the Pueblos. This place is so cool and eclectic it was exactly what I was looking for. It had easy access with our moving Vehicles we have a moving truck and a trailer which isn't easy to find parking for. This place accommodated that quite well. The air conditioner Works fantastic considering we are in the desert it was a necessity. The mini fridge was working quite well also and it had a where which is what we needed. We wanted to double beds because when we're traveling hits comfortable to have your own bed. This man was kind enough to extend our checkout time which we had a square since we had missed a lot of sleep due to having to fix a broken moving truck. We appreciated his kind gesture.
userReviews.negative: I don't think I can complain too much except for I would have liked an ice machine. However there was a Circle K next door, I prefer easy access to ice while I'm traveling for beverages Etc.

name: Desert Diamond Casino
description:
Featuring a casino and 4 restaurants on site, this hotel is 5 minutes’ drive from Tucson International Airport. Guests can relax in a year round outdoor pool.
Each air-conditioned room offers free Wi-Fi, a seating area with a work desk and a flat-screen cable TV with cable channels at Desert Diamond Casino Tucson. A small refrigerator, coffee-making facilities and an private bathroom equipped with a hairdryer are also included.
Guests can enjoy American Cuisine at The Diamond Cafe. Diamond Grill / Classico Pizza offers lunch daily and Diamond Buffet serves lunch and dinner.
A free transfer service to Tucson International Airport is offered. A fitness center and a business center are available. Free parking is provided.
University of Arizona is 15 minutes’ drive from the hotel. Silverbell Golf Course is 12 mi from Desert Diamond Casino.

description:
This hotel is within a 15-minute drive of downtown Tucson and is adjacent to St. Philip’s Plaza, which hosts a weekly farmer’s market. The hotel offers suites with a kitchenette.
Homewood Suites Tucson St. Philip's Plaza University rooms include a separate living room and a kitchenette with refrigerator and microwave. The suites are equipped with free Wi-Fi.
Guests at Homewood Suites Tucson St. Philip's Plaza University are provided with a daily continental breakfast. After breakfast guests can go for a swim in the outdoor pool or work out in the gym.
Homewood Suites Tucson St. Philip's Plaza University is located in the foothills of the Santa Catalina Mountains. The University of Arizona and the Arizona State Museum are 4 miles from the hotel.

userReviews.title: A lovely option for a stay in Tucson!
userReviews.positive: Lovely facility and comfortable suite with a little patio poolside. Barbecues are quite large and in a nice stone area with tables poolside. The bed and pillows were of excellent quality. The employee who checked us in was efficient and very friendly and helpful.
userReviews.negative: The property is over six miles off the 10 freeway but worth the drive. The shower wall had hair on it from a previous guest and there were candy wrappers between the bed and the window. However, the rest of the suite was quite clean. Given the size of the suite, the rate was a little high.

userReviews.title: Wonderful
userReviews.positive: This hotel is very close to a well-maintained linear park, and an excellent grocery store is within 10 minutes walking distance. The suite supplies all the plates, cutlery and pots and pans you need to prepare meals. When we didn't feel like cooking there are several restaurants to choose from within 50 m of the property. The hotel has two exercise rooms for the athletic-minded. The internet was high-quality. The breakfast was good on a U.S. hotel scale.
userReviews.negative: The exit door at the west end of our wing has been converted to an emergency exit only, which meant that even if we intended to travel west from the hotel we had to walk the length of the building and exit the east entrance, then backtrack to go west. The door opens into the gated pool area, so I don't understand the point of making this an emergency exit.

userReviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location
userReviews.positive: Mainly, I liked the location, updated finishes, and cleanliness. It is located in a lovely Spanish style plaza with two adjacent restaurants that share a large courtyard and have live music. I've eaten at both of the restaurants (Reforma, and Union Public House) and they both have good food and pleasant ambience. The hotel had nice finishes in both common areas and rooms, and particularly nice southwestern artwork in the common areas. I travel to Tucson regularly for business and it's the cleanest hotel that I've stayed in so far. Five-stars for cleanliness. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bedroom had a full-length mirror which was convenient. The bathroom had good water-pressure and the big mirror over the sink had lighting all around it which was good for applying make-up and very flattering. I'd stay at this hotel again.
userReviews.negative: In my Booking.com reservation, I asked for a quiet room; however, they put us in a room on the north side, facing the restaurants. I could hear the loud live music when I went to bed so if you want a quiet room, let them know you don't want to be facing the restaurants. Also, the free breakfast was the saddest I've encountered so far (although, decent quality). It had only one hot item, the chicken breakfast sandwich special; no eggs, no potatoes, no meats, no waffle station, no toast station, etc. Although our room was a nicely appointed 1-bedroom with kitchen, it was unusually small. This didn't really bother me but it is the smallest 1-bedroom I've stayed in so far. It was still a nice hotel and I would stay there again.

userReviews.title: Very Good
userReviews.positive: Excellent location close to restaurants and shopping. Good  room with kitchenette sofa bed and nice bathroom.
userReviews.negative: AC was loud.

userReviews.title: Very Good
userReviews.positive:
Nice hotel with kitchenette and bedroom, in a quiet prestigious area of ​​Tucson.
Quiet place, there are restaurants, concerts of popular artists are held outdoors in the evening. Friendly hotel staff, convenient parking lot.
There are breakfasts, but they are very meager and monotonous. Clean room, white towels. There is a pool and jacuzzi
userReviews.negative:
It was difficult to find free parking during the concerts.
The kitchen was not fully stocked: there was no frying pan, there was only one teaspoon, there was no salad bowl.
The pillowcase on one of the pillows was dirty (soiled with makeup), so it seemed that the bedding hadn't been completely changed.
And I was also very disturbed in the morning by the noise from vacuum cleaners for leaves!  He woke us up every morning.

userReviews.title: Next to fantastic walking path
userReviews.positive: Location was very good
userReviews.negative: Pool was closed,  Breakfast was very limited poor variety of food.

name: TownePlace Suites Tucson
description:
The TownePlace Suites Tucson offers all-suite accommodation in the foothills of the Santa Catalina Mountains. The hotel features an outdoor swimming pool surrounded by a terracotta sundeck.
The suites are equipped with fully-equipped kitchens, which include full-size appliances and the basic cookware. A DVD player and cable TV are provided for in-room entertainment. Guests can also easily work, making use of free Wi-Fi connection and spacious work desks.
Free coffee and tea are offered at the lobby throughout the day. A continental breakfast is served at the hotel’s café. Guests can request their breakfast to go.
TownePlace Tucson is located 14 miles from Tucson International Airport. The Tucson Mall is about 2 miles away.

name: Best Western InnSuites Tucson Foothills Hotel & Suites
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Best Western InnSuites Tucson Foothills Hotel & Suites! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
This hotel, located 18 miles from the Tucson International Airport,and free WiFi.
Best Western InnSuites Tucson Foothills Hotel & Suites features is a business center and an outdoor heated pool/spa area.  Each guest room includes a TV with expanded cable, microwave and refrigerator.
PJ's Cafe/Lounge is located on-site at Best Western Foothills.  This pet-friendly hotel offers a fitness center and guest laundry services.

Landscaping and room decor is a little tired.  Could stand some revitalization.

userReviews.title: Our stay was relaxing and comfortable.
userReviews.positive:
Breakfast had lots of choices.  The food was always stocked and if something was low, the attendant filled it promptly. I liked that it was open till 10am as being on holidays, we didn't have to get up so early.
We also liked the Happy Hour items i.e. beverage and popcorn.  Always friendly staff, 
Front desk workers were always helpful.
Enjoyed the cookies at the front desk in the afternoon with our afternoon coffee.
userReviews.negative:
There was not one thing I can say I didn't like.  However if there was one item, I would say to have a few extra items in the 'Kitchen Pack' (as we had a cooking suite).  We did receive a fry pan, pot, flipper, ladle, plates, bowls and KFS.
Perhaps a small container of dish soap, tea towel, dish cloth and sink stopper could be added.

Good size room
Breakfast was very good. Nice selection daily.
userReviews.negative:
There is a water leak in the bathroom shower/tub. I reported it as soon as I arrived and was told the hotel knew about it and it was "on the list" for repair. I thought this was rather ironic given the entire state of Arizona is facing water shortage due to drought and this faucet in bathoom was  a steady stream of water flowing down the drain..
The rooms are in a separate area from the front desk/check in area.
The heater/AC unit and thermostat did not work in the room. I reported it after first day and 2 hotel repair people came and replaced entire unit with an all new unit and thermostat. No further problems.
Totally unable to get the shower hot water adjusted. The shower would go from full on scalding hot water to cold.

userReviews.title: Wonderful
userReviews.positive: Room was clean. Included breakfast was very good, and included happy hour also!

name: Hilton Tucson East
description:
Offering easy access to shopping and dining in downtown Tucson, Arizona, this hotel offers a variety of contemporary amenities and a full-service restaurant for a comfortable stay.
Hilton Tucson East features an outdoor pool and whirlpool tub. Guests can workout in the fitness room, which boasts views of the Rincon Mountains or be productive in the 24-hour business center that offers fax, copy and printing services.
Vistas Bar & Grille at East Tucson Hilton is a full-service restaurant that serves gourmet American and Southwestern cuisine for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Located on the second floor, the restaurant boasts stunning views of the Santa Catalina Mountains. Room service is also available.
breakfast: Continental, Italian, Vegetarian, Gluten-free, American, Buffet

name: La Posada Lodge & Casitas, Ascend Hotel Collection
description:
Located in the foothills of the Catalina Mountains, this hotel offers a heated outdoor pool and rooms with views of Tucson and the rugged natural scenery. Free Wi-Fi is also included.
A flat-screen cable TV is featured in all rooms at the La Posada Lodge and Casitas. A microwave, small fridge, and coffee-making facilities are also included. Rooms offer a private entrance for maximum privacy, as well as a patio.
A hot tub and fitness center are included at the La Posada Lodge and Casitas.
The Gringo Grill & Cantina, open for lunch & dinner, features Sonora-inspired cuisine. Guests can enjoy indoor and outdoor seating, as well as drinks from the bar.
Quail Canyon Golf Course is less than a mile from the hotel. Downtown Tucson is 20 minutes’ drive away and Tucson International Airport is 30 minutes’ drive from the property.

address.full: 5900 North Oracle Road, Tucson, AZ 85704, United States of America

Floors are potentially bacteria harmful, they must be cleaned, tile floors lend themselves to look acceptable, but can be very dirty.

name: Candlewood Suites Tucson, an IHG Hotel
description:
Offering a year round outdoor heated pool and hot tub, this all-suite hotel is 15 minutes’ drive from The University of Arizona. All suites are equipped with free Wi-Fi. Parking is provided on site.
Each room includes a work desk, a flat-screen cable TV with a DVD player and an private bathroom at Candlewood Suites Tucson. A fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher, a refrigerator and a stove top is also featured.
A gazebo with barbecue facilities and a flat-screen TV is available for guest use at Tucson Candlewood Suites. Free laundry facilities are provided. A fitness center and a business center are offered.
Northwest Medical Center is 5 miles from the hotel. Pima Air and Space Museum is 25 minutes’ drive from Candlewood Suites Tucson.

name: JW Marriott Tucson Starr Pass Resort
description:
Located 6.2 mi from Central Tucson in a saguaro cactus forest, this resort has 3 golf courses, 4 dining options, 3 outdoor swimming pools and multiple hot tubs. It also features an extensive spa.
Rooms at JW Marriott Tucson Starr Pass Resort offer a flat-screen TV, a safe and a mini-bar.  All rooms include a balcony or a patio.
The on-site Hashani Spa at Marriott Tucson features a range of treatments including body scrubs, body wraps, facial treatments and massages. Guests can also enjoy yoga and Pilates at the spa fitness center.
The Signature Grill serves 3 meals per day, including a breakfast buffet, while Primo Restaurant serves Mediterranean cuisine. Catalina Barbecue Co. & Sports Bar features Southwestern cuisine. All restaurants offer a patio for outdoor dining.
Guests can hire golf equipment and enjoy lessons at the 3 golf courses with 27 holes.  There are many hiking and biking trails next to the resort.
Pima Air & Space Museum is 12 mi from JW Marriott Tucson Starr. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 9.3 mi from the accommodations.

address.full: 3800 West Starr Pass Boulevard, Tucson, AZ 85745, United States of America

name: Hampton Inn & Suites Tucson Mall
description:
Only 12 miles north of downtown Tucson, Arizona, this hotel offers excellent views of the Catalina Foothills as well as convenient amenities and helpful services.
Hampton Inn & Suites Tucson Mall is surrounded by things to do and see. Sabino Canyon and Saguaro National Monument are just minutes away. Guests can also shop at the Foothills Mall and Tucson Mall, which are both 2 miles away.
Featuring amenities such as free high-speed internet access and a complimentary morning breakfast, the Tucson Mall Hampton Inn is a great lodging choice. Guests can spend the afternoon next to the outdoor pool, then work out in the fitness center.

name: The Eddy Hotel Tucson, Tapestry Collection By Hilton

The Eddy Hotel Tucson, Tapestry Collection By Hilton is offering accommodations in Tucson. The property is located 4.7 miles from Arizona Stadium, 6.7 miles from Tucson Convention Center and 6.5 miles from Tucson Museum of Art. The property provides a 24-hour front desk and an ATM for guests.
Complete with a private bathroom equipped with free toiletries, guest rooms at the hotel have a TV and air conditioning, and certain rooms include a balcony.
Reid Park Zoo is 7.7 miles from The Eddy Hotel Tucson, Tapestry Collection By Hilton, while Pima Air & Space Museum is 15 miles away. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 11 miles from the accommodation.

userReviews.title: Beautiful hotel located in a nice area
userReviews.positive: The decor of the hotel was lovely.  The beds were really comfortable.
userReviews.negative:
We had a room w a balcony.  There was standing water on the balcony when we arrived.  There was enough water that we were tracking it into the room.  This should have been swept off prior to our arrival.  
We were disappointed early morning coffee wasn't available.  We did have a sm coffee thing in our room but the cream was bad.  We definitely would have preferred coffee available in the lobby area.  
We weren't happy with breakfast.  The food was fine but the server lacked attentiveness.  We had to request coffee refills and then it took a second request for it to be poured.  We also couldn't help but notice our breakfast dishes were left on the table for too long.  We went back up to our room and got ready for the day, when we came back down, the dishes were still there.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Tucson, an IHG Hotel
description:
A short drive from downtown Tucson and the University of Arizona, this hotel is placed off I-10 and provides an on-site convenience store and a free daily hot breakfast.
The Holiday Inn Express Tucson features a variety of thoughtful on-site amenities, including a fitness center complete with an outdoor pool. Guests can also enjoy in-room mini-refrigerators and microwaves as well as free wireless internet access.
Local attractions, including Saguaro National Park and Casino Del Sol can be found only minutes from the Tucson Holiday Inn Express. A number of local shopping centers, restaurants and entertainment options are also easily accessible.

description:
Located in Tucson, 7.6 miles from Arizona Stadium, Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Airport, Az provides accommodations with an outdoor swimming pool, free private parking, a fitness center and a bar. With free WiFi, this 3-star hotel offers free shuttle service and a 24-hour front desk. The property has BBQ facilities.
All guest rooms will provide guests with a fridge.
Buffet and American breakfast options are available every morning at the hotel.
Home2 Suites By Hilton Tucson Airport, Az has a sun terrace.

name: Super 8 by Wyndham Tucson/Grant Road Area AZ
description:
Located off Highway 10, this Tucson hotel offers spacious rooms with free WiFi and a cable TV.  It features an outdoor pool and is 1.5 miles from El Rio Golf Course.
Offering simple décor, all rooms at the Super 8 Grant Road are furnished with a work desk and a seating area.  Free bathroom amenities are provided in every room.
Guests can enjoy the sun deck with poolside seating or relax in the outdoor hot tub.  A daily breakfast is offered and the hotel staff is available around the clock at the 24-hour front desk.
The Grant Road Super 8 is just 3.3 miles from the Tucson Children’s Museum and the Tucson Botanical Garden is 5.4 miles away.  The Tucson International Airport is a 20-minute drive from the hotel.

address.full: 1550 West Grant Road, Tucson, AZ 85745 , United States of America

name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Tucson Mall, an IHG Hotel
description:
This hotel is located within 1 kmof Tucson Mall and Wetmore Park. It features an outdoor pool and a hot tub and offers accommodations with free WiFi and a sofa bed.
Each accommodations at Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites Tucson Mall features a microwave, mini-bar and mini-fridge.  Also offered is a cable TV and a work desk with ergonomic chair.
The Tucson Mall Holiday Inn Express offers a free breakfast buffet daily.  Outdoor barbecue facilities and a lounge area are available, as well as an on-site fitness center and business center.
Rillito Park and Racetrack is a 4-minute drive and the University of Arizona is a 12-minute drive from this hotel.  The Old Tucson Studios is 14 mi away.

userReviews.title: Clean and  comfortable, convenient (with a rental car), I would stay here again.
userReviews.positive: This is a  hotel that was not built for the Holiday Inn express brand. Some beautiful furnishings and features like a fountain in the courtyard. There are some little statues of musicians over the mantel in the dining room that are amazing-- wonder what their story is. Everything is clean and well cared for. Location is a 5 min drive to the big mall out of town; 10-15 min convenient by car to the University of Arizona, Tucson. Not near anything if you haven't rented a car, but if you had it's a very convenient location.
userReviews.negative: I feel that everything that is in control of the local staff is immaculate, but they could benefit from more support from the main corporation. Several things (juice machine, pancake machine) at breakfast were out of order, some it appears for awhile. Someone on hotel staff  needs to figure out how to get the people off site who fix these things to respond quicker. Some of the fixtures and features of the room (place for shampoos in the shower caddies) were part of an old design and might be able to be retrofit more creatively. Someone uses too much air freshener in the rooms, and I found the  "clean" smell a bit too much. Holiday Inn Express's brand is clean, comfortable, not fancy but everything works great. My husband prefers them because they offer free breakfast which is not automatic in America. This one has a great staff; they need to support and help them more -- but it's already a comfortable and well managed place to stay.

userReviews.title: Good

userReviews.negative: things were not working properly- hot tub, work out room, pancake maker, no towels at the pool. They didn’t seem to be in a hurry to fix things.

userReviews.title: Great location and staff!
userReviews.positive: Location was great! Staff was very friendly!
userReviews.negative: The bathtub in our room was so slippery we had to hold on to the bars in the shower. The shower head was not working properly.

userReviews.title: Hotel was very nice.
userReviews.positive: For me, the location of the Hotel was great.  I did not eat any breakfast as I had my own food.  I drove to Tucson by pickup to attend a funeral for my brother and after the funeral I left Tuesday afternoon two days early.  I understood there would be no refund for my pre-booking the Hotel room.  Since this was an emergency travel I wanted to be sure to book the hotel for as long as I thought would be necessary.   Once the funeral was over there was no need for me to stay in Tucson especially with the hot temperatures.  I also needed to  get back to Montana for my 80 year old wife.
userReviews.negative: Not able to get a refund for the days I didn't use.
userReviews.room: King Room - Mobility Access/Roll in Shower - Non-Smoking

userReviews.title: The beds were comfy, but the staff was outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel.
userReviews.positive: The staff was amazing. I had a lot of questions and they were helpful and friendly. I asked for dinner recommendations, nightlife recommendations, extra coffee pods and they were so helpful. I asked about where to watch the sunset and they put us in a room where we could see it from our window! They just went above and beyond. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable, but the staff was amazing.
userReviews.negative:
The tv was on, playing the news, during breakfast. Every channel was running coverage of the gun violence hearing in Congress. There were graphic descriptions of gun violence that I didn’t want my 8 year old to hear about. Other guests asked the staff to change the channel and they did, but we couldn’t get away from it. The staff apologized and said they would like to help, but company policy requires the news to be in during breakfast. 
Maybe you could make exceptions?

name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Tucson East
description:
The University of Arizona and downtown Tucson are 6 miles west of this all-suite hotel. It features an outdoor pool surrounded by a tropical courtyard, on-site dining and suites with 2 flat-screen TVs.
A private bedroom and separate living room are offered in every warmly decorated Embassy Suites by Hilton Tucson East. Coffee facilities, a microwave, and fridge are provided. Free Wi-Fi and in-room movies are also included.
4 Elements restaurant and bar is serving dinner daily from 5:00-9:30pm. In addition to dinner, 4 Elements cooks up a delicious hot breakfast daily. Enjoy breakfast and dinner on our open air patio by the pool.
Guests can use the gym and the business center for free.
Tucson International Airport is a 30-minute drive from this hotel. Sabino Canyon tours are 7.2 miles away and Reid Park Zoo is 15 minutes away by car.

address.full: 6555 East Speedway Boulevard, Tucson, AZ 85710, United States of America

I called back and they said they were going to wait until we left before they came up to work on it and clean it. name: Hampton Inn Tucson-Airport
description:
Providing a free 24-hour airport shuttle service, this hotel is less than half a mile from the Tucson International. Wi-Fi is provided. A free hot breakfast is served to guests daily.
Hampton Inn Tucson Airport is a completely non-smoking hotel that is near attractions such as The Bisbee Mining and Historical Museum and the Old Tucson Movie Studio. The stunning Sabino Canyon and Saguaro National Monument are also nearby.
An outdoor pool is available at the Tucson Airport Hampton Inn. A fitness center and a 24-hour business center are available.
University of Arizona, Downtown Tucson and the Pima Air & Space Museum are within 8 miles of Hampton Inn Tucson-Airport.

name: Hyatt Place Tucson Central
description:
Located just off motorway I-10 near the center of Tucson, Arizona, this hotel offers several convenient services and comfortable amenities just minutes from museums, shopping and dining.
Hyatt Place Tucson Central is near the Arizona Sonora Desert Museum and the Pima Air and Space Museum. Guests can explore the Sabino Canyon or visit the Saguaro National Monument.
With amenities such as free high-speed internet access and an outdoor pool, the Hyatt Place Tucson Central ensures a relaxing stay. After a restful night's sleep, guests will wake up to a free breakfast.

address.full: 1375 West Grant Road, Tucson, AZ 85745, United States of America

userReviews.title: Great value
userReviews.positive: The rooms were clean and spacious. The lobby was very nice. The staff is very courteous and professional. We arrived 30 minutes prior to check in on Mothers Day and they found me a clean room ready for me to check into. Fantastic service!
userReviews.negative: The pool area is small and in a weird location. But since the hotel is also in a tight location right off the freeway, we gave it a pass.

userReviews.title: Do not stay here if you can help it
userReviews.positive: The room was updated/remodel. Which was nice
userReviews.negative: Hotel is in a bad location. It is behind a ghetto circle k and next to a really ghetto old motel. There are a lot of bums all around. The pool area is not secure. People prop the pool gate open and people from the ghetto motel come over and whomever. It is a safety concern and we did not use the pool for this reason. We told the staff and they are very aware of it always happening.. They seem a bit tired of it themselves and I am surprised management doesn't do something about it. It is a huge liability waiting to happen. Breakfast was not good compared to other Hyatts we have stayed at. Bagels, frozen Jimmy Dean sandwiches, a horrible frozen sausage sandwich that has some weir herbs in it that taste horrible...or cereal. We ended up eating at Donut Bar instead which we love. When we first arrived our wall unit AC was not working. Instead of switching us to a new room they sent maintenance in to fix it for 30 to 40 mins. He had to replace the whole unit while we were in the room. I felt horrible for the guy having to mess with the super old wall units infront of guests. The are pet friendly but do not really have places to take your pet potty... and make sure you don't go to the parking lot alone as there are a lot of people on drugs all around and we even saw a guy on a bike with a mask,/back pack meet up with another shady fellow for what looked like a drug deal. The room was clean but towels had stains on them and almost every single one had a long black hair folded up in them. I even went and asked for new towels. The gave me 3 and even the new towels, (2 out of 3) had a long black hair. The next morning there was a cleaning lady cleaning rooms with her long black hair not pulled back into a pony tail...which explains a lot. I am super disappointed in Hyatt as we normally have amazing stays with them but this location is super bad.
userReviews.room: Queen Room with Two Queen Beds

userReviews.title: Very Poor
userReviews.positive: Awful. Our bathroom was filthy, and overall the room was not clean. Our air conditioning unit didn’t work, and when reported to the staff they said they’d have someone look at it, but didn’t seem to care. Close to the airport which was nice on our first night as our flight didn’t get in until after midnight. We checked out the next morning and stayed elsewhere.
userReviews.negative: We have been staying in Hyatt’s exclusively for the past three years, and this experience has caused us to look at using other brands. We won’t stay in a Hyatt again after this. Disgusting.

userReviews.title: Poor
userReviews.negative: We stayed there for 9 nights . Room service supposed to be in once in a 4 days however they just showed up once during the entire visit and they even did not clean the room properly. We stucked in the same elevator twice although they should have called the service before.
userReviews.room: Queen Room with Two Queen Beds - Disability Access

userReviews.title: I will never stay at Tucson Hyatt Central again.
userReviews.positive: The beds were comfortable.
userReviews.negative: The room was not 100% clean (dried liquid left on the dresser) - no shampoo etc.  I understand that this may be due to COVID.  The location is near homelessness and this is not what I'm used to when I pay to stay at a Hyatt.
userReviews.room: Superior Queen Room with Two Queen Beds

userReviews.title: So cozy!
userReviews.positive: We left a terrible motel across the street and for just $30 more, we got a beautiful clean room with excellent hospitality here at the Hyatt. The front desk agent even had our breakfast prepared for our 5am departure the next day. Highly recommend!

name: Sonesta ES Suites Tucson
description:
Sonesta ES Suites Tucson offers self-catering suites with free internet access and a flat-screen TV, just 7.7 miles from the Sabina Canyon. Facilities include an outdoor pool and whirlpool.
The air-conditioned suites of Sonesta ES Suites Tucson are decorated with wooden furnishings. All suites have a living area and a well-equipped kitchen with an oven.
A prepackaged breakfast is provided and includes a muffin or Danish, a granola bar and a piece of fruit. A bottled water and coffee station are also provided.
Sonesta ES Suites Tucson also offers a gym and laundry facilities.
Trail Dust Town is just 1.1 miles from Sonesta ES Suites Tucson. Saguaro National Park is 9.7 miles from the hotel, and the Pima Air & Space Museum is 10.8 miles away.

userReviews.title: Pleasant stay, very charming suite.

userReviews.negative: No complaints

userReviews.title: Good
userReviews.positive: Bed was comfortable. Love the sheet/blanket configuration. Way better than just a sheet and thin blanket. Full size fridge was great. Nice and quiet, too.
userReviews.negative: No luggage stands! There was nothing at all to put your luggage on, which is very disappointing. . When I called the front desk to ask, she just stated that "we're a "hospitality hotel", so we don't have them in any of the rooms.". No clue what that even means. If anything, a "hospitality hotel" should have more amenities, not less! There were 2 closets, one without a hanger bar, so only a tall shelf above on which to lay your clothes. Then, the toilet didn't flush properly. You had to hold the handle down the whole time, then do that again 2-4 more times to get the paper to go down!

name: La Quinta by Wyndham Tucson Airport
description:
Featuring a free shuttle service to Tucson International Airport, less than half a mile away, this hotel offers a heated outdoor swimming pool and serves a daily continental breakfast. The University of Arizona is 8 miles away.
Each room provides a flat-screen cable TV, a seating area, free Wi-Fi and an private bathroom at LA Quinta Inn & Suites Tucson Airport.
A 24-hour reception welcomes guests to Tucson Airport La Quinta Inn & Suites. Laundry facilities is also provided.
The Pima Air & Space Museum is 15 minutes’ drive away.  Tucson Convention Center is 9 miles away from La Quinta Inn & Suites Tucson Airport.

name: Four Points by Sheraton Tucson Airport
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Four Points by Sheraton Tucson Airport! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Located 600 feet from Tucson International Airport, this hotel provides a free 24-hour airport shuttle service. Free Wi-Fi is available. An on-site bar and grill serves breakfast, lunch and dinner daily.
A 37-inch flat-screen cable TV, microwave and fridge are provided in every Tucson Airport Sheraton room. A work desk and a lounge chair are also available. Each room is decorated in warm colors and wood furniture.
R&R Grill serves American cuisine for breakfast, lunch and dinner. R&R Sports Bar has multiple flat-screen TVs and features local beers. A breakfast buffet is provided daily.
Four Points by Sheraton Tucson Airport has a outdoor pool surrounded by 5 landscaped acres for guest use. A fitness center and a business center are on site.
University of Arizona is a 15-minute drive from the hotel. Downtown Tucson is 8 miles from Four Points by Sheraton Tucson Airport.

userReviews.title: Good location, but overpriced
userReviews.positive: Very convenient location right by the airport. Has a free shuttle. Rooms were clean, breakfast was abundant (enormous pancakes). Breakfast is not buffet-style, so there is a server giving you a menu and then serving you. Server was polite and even offered us extra juice.  Had fridge and freezer in room plus microwave. Room was spacious. Nice desk space for work.  Nice pool area.
userReviews.negative: Motel-style setting. Something in the room (fridge. freezer, generator?) was making loud noises all night, then in the morning noisy door from people exciting building, so we got little sleep. Clock in room had wrong time set (time doesn't change in Arizona) so made us arrive late for our shuttle. No free bottle of water in fridge, had to go ask for it. Receptionist said no breakfast was included with our stay and that we had to pay. I had to do another trip to go grab my receipt and show that I paid extra to have breakfast. Manager explained that when booked through third parties some info doesn't come through. This is something that would need fixed.

name: Comfort Inn & Suites North Tucson Marana
description:
While staying at this Comfort Inn and Suites, the following amenities are provided for your convenience: free hot breakfast, free high-speed wireless Internet access, free weekly newspaper, outdoor seasonal pool and hot tub.
All of our premium rooms include a flat-screen plasma television with cable/satellite services, pillow top mattresses, microwave and refrigerator. Connecting rooms and sofa beds are available in some rooms. This hotel has a nonsmoking premise.
For business travelers, a computer with Internet access is available in our lobby as well as fax and copy services. Free local calls and a state-of-the-art exercise room are open to all guests.
Within easy distance of this hotel are: The Old Tucson Studios,  Mission San Xavier, Saguaro National Park, Arizona Sonora Desert Museum and Pima Air and Space Museum.

name: Days Inn & Suites by Wyndham Tucson/Marana
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Days Inn & Suites by Wyndham Tucson/Marana! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Located off Interstate 10, this pet-friendly hotel offers an outdoor pool and hot tub. It offers a grab-and-go breakfast. Tucson town center is 15 miles away.
Free Wi-Fi is provided in each air-conditioned room at Days Inn and Suites – NW Tucson/Marana.  The spacious guest rooms include a cable TV, a microwave, a refrigerator and a coffee maker.
A 24-hour reception greets guests of Days Inn and Suites - NW Tucson / Marana. Guests have access to a business center with fax and photocopying services.
Crooked Tree Golf Course is 4 miles away from this hotel.  Old Tucson Studios are 30 minutes’ drive away.  Historic Mission Patronato San Xavier is 21 miles away from this Days Inn.

userReviews.title: Perfect for a low-priced but super comfy stay
userReviews.positive: The beds and pillows are SUPER comfortable. I slept very well at this hotel for a week. The location is awesome because you can walk right nextdoor to Cracker Barrel for great food at good prices, not to mention all the other basic chains (Starbucks, Walmart) that are about a block away. My room was also very quiet. I used the wifi for work Zoom meetings and it was perfect. The staff and management were very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. There is a washing machine and dryer available for use, and the front desk will sell you quarters, which was convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

name: Hotel McCoy - Art, Coffee, Beer, Wine
description:
You're eligible for a Genius discount at Hotel McCoy - Art, Coffee, Beer, Wine! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in.
Set 1.3 mi from Tucson Convention Center, Hotel McCoy - Art, Coffee, Beer, Wine offers 3-star accommodations in Tucson and features free bikes. The property is around 2.7 mi from Arizona Stadium and 1.7 mi from Tucson Museum of Art. The property is 3.7 mi from Reid Park Zoo.
Entire property is on the ground floor.
At the hotel, the rooms include a desk. Each room comes with a flat-screen TV, and selected rooms come with a mountain view. All guest rooms will provide guests with a private bathroom.
A continental breakfast is available daily at Hotel McCoy.
The wellness area at the accommodations is consisted of of a fitness center. You can play table tennis at Hotel McCoy - Art, Coffee, Beer, Wine.
When guests need guidance on where to visit, the reception will be happy to provide advice.
Pima Air & Space Museum is 8.1 mi from the hotel, while Pima Air Museum is 9.3 mi from the property. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 6.2 mi from the property.

userReviews.title: A truly unique experience - in the best way!
userReviews.positive: This place is a gem! Clean, comfortable rooms that aren't overly decorated but definitely give a vibe. Convenient to 1-10, Menlo Park, Tucson Mountain Park and the western part of Saguaro National Park, but still quiet when you want to sleep. The bar has a good selection of beer and wine and the heated pool was amazing, even though it was colder outside than normal. We enjoyed all the artwork around the property, too - a unique, local touch. This was our first trip to Tucson and we loved it. When we visit again, we will definitely plan to stay at the Hotel McCoy.
userReviews.negative: If there was one negative, it's no coffee pot in the room. They offer coffee in the lobby in the morning as part of the breakfast, but as an extra early riser I need my coffee sooner and preferably without human interaction. There is a small stovetop in the room, so we bought instant Starbucks and boiled some water. Super easy, barely an inconvenience.

userReviews.title: Great Vibe close to Saguaro National Park!
userReviews.positive:
The employees are great! We loved the mixture of guests from young to old, and some brought their dogs..   Really cool atmosphere.  We stayed 3 nights.   On Tuesdays, Irish players from around the Tucson area come and play.
It was really awesome!  Alexandria at the bar and Jack at the food truck are amazing.   Make sure to order the fried cauliflower and chicken wings! Fun games like corn hole,  ping pong, etc., and beautiful artwork around the motel for picture ops. The pool is heated and stays open late at night.. The oatmeal bar is good.  Housekeeping staff are super nice!  The location is great if you like going to breweries and hiking.  Some really good Mexican food is close as well.  I wouldn't say they area is walkable as it's a little rough,but the motel is a sanctuary..
userReviews.negative: We didn't have a closet in our room.   There's a rack on the wall you can hang things on, but not enough for two women. I was expecting a closet...Also, there wasn't a lampshade on the foor.lamp between the beds.. Kinda weird with just a bare light bulb.

userReviews.title: Pleasant enough, great front desk staff, and good price and location.
userReviews.positive: We arrived by car and the drive was quicker than expected so we were a little early to check in. The young man at the desk when we arrived was very professional and kind. He went to check on room readiness and invited us to relax in comfy chairs in the lobby and use the wifi, watch TV etc. I'm sorry I didn't get his name because it was just a few minutes until shift change and Barbara took over. Most of our wait was with her and she was delightful. She took over checking room cleaning progress and we enjoyed chatting with her while she worked. They did get us into a first floor room, as we'd requested, and a few minutes early. Later we consulted with her about nearby restaurants and she was generous and gave it some thought, made a few recommendations, and answered other questions about traffic and events downtown etc. We felt welcome and cared for, which we appreciated very much.
userReviews.negative: Giving this place a little lower score because it could use some maintenance, paint etc. It looks a little shabby. name: Baymont by Wyndham Tucson Airport

name: Doubletree By Hilton Tucson Downtown Convention Center
description:
Located in Tucson, a few steps from Tucson Convention Center, Doubletree By Hilton Tucson Downtown Convention Center provides accommodations with a fitness center, private parking, a restaurant and a bar. This 3-star hotel offers room service and a 24-hour front desk. The property has an ATM and a concierge service for guests.
Complete with a private bathroom, guest rooms at the hotel are equipped with air conditioning, and some rooms are equipped with a balcony.
The daily breakfast offers à la carte, continental or American options.
Popular points of interest near Doubletree By Hilton Tucson Downtown Convention Center include Tucson Museum of Art, Tucson City Hall and Pima County Public Library. The nearest airport is Tucson International Airport, 7.5 miles from the accommodation.

userReviews.positive: I loved that we got a hotel attached to the convention center. Location is great!
userReviews.negative:
Breakfast Buffet wasn't worth the price. Could be better. 
Pay to self park is just dumb. I personally disagree with it. 
I hated the fact that we selected this to be at a convention and we could not use the door that connects the hotel to the convention center. It was even staffed with security who could validate our badges. We had to walk the near quarter mile around the block in the Arizona heat to get to the front door. There should be some sort of agreement between the hotel and the convention to allow for ease of access. It's literally staffed for it. I posted on the convention center about this as well, so hopefully there is communication somewhere.

name: AC Hotel Tucson Downtown
description:
Set in Tucson, AC Hotel Tucson Downtown is 2,300 feet from Tucson Convention Center and features an outdoor pool. The property is located 1.2 mi from Arizona Stadium, 2,650 feet from Tucson Museum of Art and 3.1 mi from Reid Park Zoo. The property provides free WiFi.
All rooms at the hotel have a seating area, a work desk and a flat-screen cable TV. There is also a private bathroom with free toiletries. Selected rooms also feature pool view.
Guests at the accommodations can enjoy a buffet breakfast. The hotel offers a business center and a fitness center for guest use.
Pima Air & Space Museum is 8.1 mi from AC Hotel Tucson Downtown. Tucson International Airport is 7.5 mi away.
